summary: Regulates usage of surveillance devices in the workplace in New South Wales.
Requires employers to give 2 weeks notice before surveillance begins.
For pre-existing surveillance, employees are notified prior to starting work.
The notice must specify what surveillance is used; Cameras must be visible and have signs attached; Computer surveillance has a secondary notice and must be within the employees contract.

Surveillance cannot occur in change rooms or bathrooms; on work devices being used outside of work; cannot block internet/emails without notice (unless it menacing, harassment, offensive, spam or may have resulted in unauthorised interference to the employers network).
Establishes procedures for law enforcement officers to obtain warrants relating to surveillance technology, such as:

Law enforcement officers: Data related to safe recovery of children
Installation and usage of surveillance devices, where it is related to terrorism
AFP / ACC: Data that is likely to assist in frustrating the commission of relevant offences
Chief officer of AFP / ACC: Authorise access of data stored in computers
Data that will substantially assist in collection of intelligence that relates to criminal networks
